CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Further fine - tuning of the LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer by structural modification may improve V OC and promote the utilization of more NIR light by the lower bandgap materials . In conclusion , a highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response , PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , based on alternating 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione units has been synthesized. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has high hole mobility ( 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved. Considering the sufficiently high I SC values of this system , more promising photovoltaic performance is thought to be achievable by using other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels , such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH. 14 Further device optimization and the synthesis of new μmRpolymers are currently in progress and will be reported in due course. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole and

Let's think step by step.

1. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu): This is the name of the synthesized photovoltaic polymer.
2. 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2,5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione: This is the structural description of one of the units used in the synthesis of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu).
3. PDTP: An abbreviation for a part of the name of the synthesized polymer.
4. DTDPP(Bu): An abbreviation for a part of the name of the synthesized polymer.
5. 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2,5-dibutylpyrrole: An abbreviated form of the structural description mentioned above.
6. 3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole: A part of the structural description of one of the units used in the synthesized polymer.
7. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole: A different type of μmRpolymer that is currently being synthesized and optimized.

These are the "Material Name" entities identified in the paragraph.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Material Name.

1. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu)
2. 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2,5-dibutylpyrrole-1,4-dione
3. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole

These are the entities in the paragraph that clearly refer to Material Names.

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

PN.content:
Please identify the Property Names of materials in the following paragraph.

Paragraph: Further fine - tuning of the LUMO and HOMO levels of the polymer by structural modification may improve V OC and promote the utilization of more NIR light by the lower bandgap materials . In conclusion , a highly effective photovoltaic polymer with NIR response , PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) , based on alternating 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2 , 5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione units has been synthesized. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) has high hole mobility ( 0.05 cm^2 V -1 s^-1 ) and broad photocurrent response wavelengths from 300 nm to 1.1 μm. The photovoltaic properties of PDTP - DTDPP(Bu) were preliminarily investigated , and high shortcircuit current ( 14.87 mA / cm^2 ) and PCE ( 2.71% ) were achieved. Considering the sufficiently high I SC values of this system , more promising photovoltaic performance is thought to be achievable by using other fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels , such as bis-PCBM 13 or Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH. 14 Further device optimization and the synthesis of new μmRpolymers are currently in progress and will be reported in due course. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole and

Let's think step by step.

1. LUMO and HOMO levels: These are the energy levels in a material, specifically the Lowest Unoccupied Molecular Orbital (LUMO) and Highest Occupied Molecular Orbital (HOMO).
2. Polymer: A large organic molecule that can be synthesized from monomers. In this context, it refers to the photovoltaic polymer.
3. Voc: Voltage at the open circuit, a measure of the maximum voltage that a photovoltaic cell can generate under illumination.
4. NIR: Near-infrared, a region of the electromagnetic spectrum.
5. PDTP - DTDPP(Bu): A specific photovoltaic polymer, with alternating 3,6-dithien-2-yl-2,5-dibutylpyrrolo[3,4-c]pyrrole-1,4-dione units.
6. Hole mobility: The mobility of holes (positive charge carriers) in a material.
7. Isc: Short-circuit current, the maximum current that a photovoltaic cell can generate under illumination.
8. PCE: Power conversion efficiency, a measure of the efficiency of a photovoltaic cell in converting light energy into electrical energy.
9. Fullerene derivatives: Modified forms of fullerenes, a type of carbon molecule.
10. Bis-PCBM 13 and Lu3N @ C80 - PCBH: Specific fullerene derivatives with high LUMO energy levels.
11. μmRpolymers: Unspecified photovoltaic polymers that are currently being synthesized.
12. N-[1- (2-ethylhexyl)-3-ethylheptanyl]dithieno[3,2-b : 2^0 ,3 0 -d]pyrrole: A specific organic compound mentioned in the text.
Please remove irrelevant entities and only keep the entities that clearly refer to Property Name of Material.

1. LUMO and HOMO levels
2. Hole mobility
3. Short-circuit current (Isc)
4. Power conversion efficiency (PCE)

Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| LUMO and HOMO levels |
| Hole mobility |
| Short-circuit current (Isc) |
| Power conversion efficiency (PCE) |
